---
title: "Aula 6"
format: html
editor_options: 
  chunk_output_type: console
---


# Aula 6

## Importar planilha de dados diversos


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_3e0f6a6b497c8042e14dc6a76988e978'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(gsheet)
mg <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=983033137")
```
:::


## Vizualizar


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_ad6308d5bb6b81a3be963702a1c96551'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.0     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggthemes)


mg |> 
  ggplot(aes(trat, comp))+
  geom_boxplot(fill = "gray")+
  theme_few()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Teste t para dois grupos de médias independentes


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_e5c9442c78dc6d002414eae6ebcc92dd'}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Passar os dados para o formato largo
mg2 <- mg |> 
  pivot_wider(names_from = trat, values_from = comp)
 
mg2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 × 3
     rep   Mg2 control
   <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>
 1     1   9      13.7
 2     2  12.5    15.9
 3     3  10      15.7
 4     4   8      14.2
 5     5  13.2    15.9
 6     6  11      16.5
 7     7  10.8    18  
 8     8   9.5    14.4
 9     9  10.8    16.4
10    10  10.4    16  
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Presupposes: normality and homogeneity of variance

shapiro.test(mg2$control) #No teste de shapiro a H0 é de que a distribuição é normal
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  mg2$control
W = 0.93886, p-value = 0.5404
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(mg2$control)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(mg2$Mg2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  mg2$Mg2
W = 0.97269, p-value = 0.9146
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(mg2$Mg2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
var.test(mg2$control, mg2$Mg2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	F test to compare two variances

data:  mg2$control and mg2$Mg2
F = 0.67654, num df = 9, denom df = 9, p-value = 0.5698
alternative hypothesis: true ratio of variances is not equal to 1
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.1680428 2.7237436
sample estimates:
ratio of variances 
         0.6765394 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(mg2$control)
qqline(mg2$control)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-3.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#T test
teste1 <- t.test(mg2$control, mg2$Mg2) #Pode usar 'var.equal = FALSE' quando a variância for heterogênea
```
:::


## Reportar o resultado


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_96980c8dda747a6473a3128c4f065639'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(report)
report(teste1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: Function `format_text()` is deprecated and will be removed in a future
  release. Please use `text_format()` instead.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Effect sizes were labelled following Cohen's (1988) recommendations.

The Welch Two Sample t-test testing the difference between mg2$control and
mg2$Mg2 (mean of x = 15.68, mean of y = 10.52) suggests that the effect is
positive, statistically significant, and large (difference = 5.16, 95% CI
[3.83, 6.49], t(17.35) = 8.15, p < .001; Cohen's d = 3.65, 95% CI [2.14, 5.12])
```
:::
:::


## Teste t para dois grupos de médias dependentes


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_0602fd3a7ccbc221cbc803301044df56'}

```{.r .cell-code}
escala <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=1729131173")

#Vizualizar
escala |> 
  ggplot(aes(assessment, acuracia))+
  geom_boxplot(fill = "gray")+
  theme_few()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Passar os dados para o formato largo
escala2 <- escala |> 
  select(assessment, rater, acuracia) |> 
  pivot_wider(names_from = assessment, values_from = acuracia)


 escala2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 × 3
   rater Unaided Aided1
   <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl>
 1 A        0.81   0.91
 2 B        0.72   0.91
 3 C        0.4    0.91
 4 D        0.82   0.96
 5 E        0.75   0.96
 6 F        0.45   0.9 
 7 G        0.81   0.85
 8 H        0.78   0.88
 9 I        0.78   0.95
10 J        0.5    0.94
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Presupposes: normality and homogeneity of variance

shapiro.test(escala2$Unaided) #No teste de shapiro a H0 é de que a distribuição é normal
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  escala2$Unaided
W = 0.7748, p-value = 0.007155
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(escala2$Unaided)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(escala2$Unaided)
qqline(escala2$Unaided)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-3.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(escala2$Aided1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  escala2$Aided1
W = 0.92852, p-value = 0.4335
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(escala2$Aided1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-4.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(escala2$Aided1)
qqline(escala2$Aided1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-5.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Homogeneidade de variância
var.test(escala2$Unaided, escala2$Aided1) #Ho é que a variância é homogênea
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	F test to compare two variances

data:  escala2$Unaided and escala2$Aided1
F = 20.978, num df = 9, denom df = 9, p-value = 0.000106
alternative hypothesis: true ratio of variances is not equal to 1
95 percent confidence interval:
  5.210754 84.459185
sample estimates:
ratio of variances 
          20.97847 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#T test
teste2 <- t.test(escala2$Unaided, escala2$Aided1,
                 paired = TRUE,
                 var.equal = FALSE) #Usar 'paired = TRUE' quando o teste t for pareado (média dependentes) e 'var.equal = FALSE' quando a variância for heterogêneanea

teste2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Paired t-test

data:  escala2$Unaided and escala2$Aided1
t = -4.4214, df = 9, p-value = 0.001668
alternative hypothesis: true mean difference is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 -0.3552353 -0.1147647
sample estimates:
mean difference 
         -0.235 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
report(teste2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: Function `format_text()` is deprecated and will be removed in a future
  release. Please use `text_format()` instead.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Effect sizes were labelled following Cohen's (1988) recommendations.

The Paired t-test testing the difference between escala2$Unaided and
escala2$Aided1 (mean difference = -0.23) suggests that the effect is negative,
statistically significant, and large (difference = -0.23, 95% CI [-0.36,
-0.11], t(9) = -4.42, p = 0.002; Cohen's d = -1.40, 95% CI [-2.27, -0.49])
```
:::
:::


## Teste T não paramétrico


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_ca4ec4564ee7cab509ba52332adc21c4'}

```{.r .cell-code}
escala_np <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=1729131173")

#Vizualizar
escala_np |> 
  ggplot(aes(assessment, acuracia))+
  geom_boxplot(fill = "gray")+
  theme_few()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Passar os dados para o formato largo
escala_np2 <- escala_np |> 
  select (assessment, rater, acuracia) |> 
  pivot_wider(names_from = assessment, values_from = acuracia)
 
escala_np2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 × 3
   rater Unaided Aided1
   <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl>
 1 A        0.81   0.91
 2 B        0.72   0.91
 3 C        0.4    0.91
 4 D        0.82   0.96
 5 E        0.75   0.96
 6 F        0.45   0.9 
 7 G        0.81   0.85
 8 H        0.78   0.88
 9 I        0.78   0.95
10 J        0.5    0.94
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Presupposes: normality and homogeneity of variance

shapiro.test(escala_np2$Unaided) #No teste de shapiro a H0 é de que a distribuição é normal
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  escala_np2$Unaided
W = 0.7748, p-value = 0.007155
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(escala_np2$Unaided)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(escala_np2$Unaided)
qqline(escala_np2$Unaided)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-3.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(escala_np2$Aided1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  escala_np2$Aided1
W = 0.92852, p-value = 0.4335
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(escala_np2$Aided1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-4.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(escala_np2$Aided1)
qqline(escala_np2$Aided1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-5.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Equivalente ao teste t não paramétrico = teste wilcox
teste3 <- wilcox.test(escala_np2$Unaided, escala_np2$Aided1, paired = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in wilcox.test.default(escala_np2$Unaided, escala_np2$Aided1, paired =
TRUE): não é possível computar o valor de p exato com o de desempate
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
teste3
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Wilcoxon signed rank test with continuity correction

data:  escala_np2$Unaided and escala_np2$Aided1
V = 0, p-value = 0.005889
alternative hypothesis: true location shift is not equal to 0
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_0407cb2b83a470dbb2db1e77bff1f5a3'}

```{.r .cell-code}
micelial <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=959387827")

#Vizualizar
micelial |> 
  ggplot(aes(especie, tcm))+
  geom_boxplot(fill = "gray")+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.1, size = 2)+
  theme_few()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
anova_micelial <- aov(tcm ~ especie, data = micelial)
 
anova_micelial
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Call:
   aov(formula = tcm ~ especie, data = micelial)

Terms:
                  especie Residuals
Sum of Squares  1.4695800 0.4679167
Deg. of Freedom         4        25

Residual standard error: 0.1368089
Estimated effects may be unbalanced
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(anova_micelial)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value   Pr(>F)    
especie      4 1.4696  0.3674   19.63 2.03e-07 ***
Residuals   25 0.4679  0.0187                     
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
anova(anova_micelial)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: tcm
          Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
especie    4 1.46958 0.36739  19.629 2.028e-07 ***
Residuals 25 0.46792 0.01872                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
anova_micelial2 <- lm(tcm ~ especie, data = micelial)

anova_micelial2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = tcm ~ especie, data = micelial)

Coefficients:
(Intercept)  especieFaus  especieFcor  especieFgra  especieFmer  
      1.572       -0.335       -0.250       -0.660       -0.145  
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(anova_micelial2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = tcm ~ especie, data = micelial)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-0.23667 -0.09667  0.01583  0.08833  0.28333 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  1.57167    0.05585  28.140  < 2e-16 ***
especieFaus -0.33500    0.07899  -4.241 0.000266 ***

```


```
          Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
especie    4 1.46958 0.36739  19.629 2.028e-07 ***
```

## Modificando os dados p termos variância significativa


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_a2825b0a5914a011fd2b1dae11cca34a'}

```{.r .cell-code}
micelial2 <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=959387827")

#Vizualizar
micelial2 |> 
  ggplot(aes(especie, tcm))+
  #geom_boxplot()+
  geom_jitter(widh = 0.05, size = 2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in geom_jitter(widh = 0.05, size = 2): Ignoring unknown parameters:
`widh`
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
aov_micelial2 <- aov(tcm ~ especie, data = micelial2)
 
aov_micelial2
```

## Testes de comparações


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_edd12acf303be2769843a1c866d87ba0'}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Demonstrando os agrupamentos de médias
install.packages("emmeans", repos = "https://cran.r-project.org")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Installing package into 'C:/Users/david/AppData/Local/R/win-library/4.3'
(as 'lib' is unspecified)
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
package 'emmeans' successfully unpacked and MD5 sums checked

The downloaded binary packages are in
	C:\Users\david\AppData\Local\Temp\Rtmpyg4TJ2\downloaded_packages
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("multcomp", repos = "https://cran.r-project.org")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Installing package into 'C:/Users/david/AppData/Local/R/win-library/4.3'
(as 'lib' is unspecified)
```

## O pacote 'performance' também roda as presuposições


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_720a5a32d1066f176e69c67f15c9d7ef'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(performance)

check_normality(lm_micelial2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.878).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(lm_micelial2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.880).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot_presup <- check_model(lm_micelial2)

plot_presup
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


# Aula 6.1


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-11_af9723b9fe56c0f52686f71354f11a52'}

```{.r .cell-code}
Inseticida <- InsectSprays

Inseticida |>
  count(spray)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
  spray  n
1     A 12
2     B 12
3     C 12
4     D 12
5     E 12
6     F 12
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
Inseticida |> 
  ggplot(aes(spray, count))+
  geom_boxplot(fill = "gray")+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.1, size = 2)+
  theme_classic()+
  scale_fill_colorblind()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-12_eb2b1016be29fbd3f7ad892853948528'}

```{.r .cell-code}
m1 <- lm (count ~ spray, data = Inseticida)

anova(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: count
          Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
spray      5 2668.8  533.77  34.702 < 2.2e-16 ***
Residuals 66 1015.2   15.38                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = count ~ spray, data = Inseticida)

Residuals:
   Min     1Q Median     3Q    Max 
-8.333 -1.958 -0.500  1.667  9.333 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  14.5000     1.1322  12.807  < 2e-16 ***
sprayB        0.8333     1.6011   0.520    0.604    
sprayC      -12.4167     1.6011  -7.755 7.27e-11 ***
sprayD       -9.5833     1.6011  -5.985 9.82e-08 ***
sprayE      -11.0000     1.6011  -6.870 2.75e-09 ***
sprayF        2.1667     1.6011   1.353    0.181    
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 3.922 on 66 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.7244,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.7036 
F-statistic:  34.7 on 5 and 66 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(m1$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(m1$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  m1$residuals
W = 0.96006, p-value = 0.02226
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(m1$residuals)
qqline(m1$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
bartlett.test(count ~ spray,
              data = Inseticida)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Bartlett test of homogeneity of variances

data:  count by spray
Bartlett's K-squared = 25.96, df = 5, p-value = 9.085e-05
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(performance)
check_normality(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Warning: Non-normality of residuals detected (p = 0.022).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Warning: Heteroscedasticity (non-constant error variance) detected (p < .001).
```
:::
:::


## Tranformando os dados


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-13_413ff966729e307573994b56fbf593bf'}

```{.r .cell-code}
Inseticida <- Inseticida |> 
  mutate(count2 = sqrt(count))

Inseticida |> 
  ggplot(aes(spray, count2, fill= spray))+
  geom_boxplot()+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.05, size = 2)+
  theme_few()+
  scale_fill_few()+
  theme(legend.title = element_blank(), legend.position = "none")
```

## Transformação BoxCox


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-17_ebbdc571beb4a7185b17c4f566308425'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(MASS)

b <- boxcox(lm(Inseticida$count+0.1 ~ 1))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-17-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
lambda <- b$x[which.max(b$y)]
lambda = 0.5

Inseticida$count3 <-(Inseticida$count ^ lambda - 1) / lambda

hist(Inseticida$count3)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-17-2.png){width=672}
:::

## Anova fatorial


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-18_6afa0ec6c8d1d4ab406d7683213f3e16'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(gsheet)
fungicida <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=2023059672")


fungicida$dose <- as.factor(fungicida$dose)

fungicida |> 
  ggplot(aes(treat,severity, color = dose))+
  #geom_boxplot()+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.2, size = 2.5)+
  #facet_wrap(~dose)+
  theme_few()+
  scale_fill_few()+
  theme(legend.title = element_blank(), legend.position = "none")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
mf <- lm(severity ~ treat*dose, data = fungicida)

mf
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = severity ~ treat * dose, data = fungicida)

Coefficients:
            (Intercept)        treatTebuconazole                    dose2  
                 0.2921                  -0.2711                  -0.2420  
treatTebuconazole:dose2  
                 0.2412  
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
anova(mf)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: severity
           Df   Sum Sq  Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
treat       1 0.113232 0.113232  30.358 4.754e-05 ***
dose        1 0.073683 0.073683  19.755 0.0004077 ***
treat:dose  1 0.072739 0.072739  19.502 0.0004326 ***
Residuals  16 0.059678 0.003730                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(simulateResiduals(mf))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
mf_medias <- emmeans(mf, ~ treat | dose)
mf_medias
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
dose = 0.5:
 treat        emmean     SE df lower.CL upper.CL
 Ionic liquid 0.2921 0.0273 16  0.23420   0.3500
 Tebuconazole 0.0210 0.0273 16 -0.03690   0.0789

dose = 2:
 treat        emmean     SE df lower.CL upper.CL
 Ionic liquid 0.0501 0.0273 16 -0.00781   0.1080
 Tebuconazole 0.0202 0.0273 16 -0.03768   0.0781

Confidence level used: 0.95 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cld(mf_medias)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
dose = 0.5:
 treat        emmean     SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group
 Tebuconazole 0.0210 0.0273 16 -0.03690   0.0789  1    
 Ionic liquid 0.2921 0.0273 16  0.23420   0.3500   2   

dose = 2:
 treat        emmean     SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group
 Tebuconazole 0.0202 0.0273 16 -0.03768   0.0781  1    
 Ionic liquid 0.0501 0.0273 16 -0.00781   0.1080  1    

Confidence level used: 0.95 
significance level used: alpha = 0.05 
NOTE: If two or more means share the same grouping symbol,
      then we cannot show them to be different.
      But we also did not show them to be the same. 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
mf_medias_linha <- emmeans(mf, ~ dose | treat)
mf_medias_linha
```
